alert.note: Alert for Greater Oconee; Oconee Mountains (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 5:07AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Stephens, Habersham, Rabun and central Oconee Counties through 600 AM EDT... At 507 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Franklin to 10 miles southeast of Hiawassee to 3 miles north of Dahlonega. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Walhalla, Clayton, Clarkesville, Cornelia, Baldwin, Demorest, Mount Airy, Alto and Mountain City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
